translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Nāḷimāla
The Story of the Elder Pūlinacaṅkame
“In the past I was a hunter,
in the forest, in the jungle;
Searching for a deer,
I saw a walking path.
Taking a piece of meat on the tip of a blade of grass,
I sprinkled it on the walking path;
With a serene mind, joyful,
of the Gracious One, of the One of Great Renown.
Thirty-one eons ago,
I sprinkled the walking path;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the walking path.
My defilements have been burned up,
I live undefiled.
How welcome it was for me,
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.
The four analytical insights,
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Pūlinacaṅkame recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pulinacaṅkamiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Pulinacaṅkamiyattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā pulinacaṅkamiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  pulinacaṅkamiya therassa apadānam dasama
translated: The Story of the Elder Pūlinacaṅkame is the tenth.
The Chapter with Nāḷimāla is the forty-eighth.
The summary:
Nāḷimāla, Maṇidada,
Ukkāsatikabījanī;
Kummāsa, Kusaṭṭha,
And Giripunnāgi too.
The creeper, the drinking hall,
and the mud-pool walk,
The ninety-five verses
have been counted by the wise.
